topics.title: Overview
topics.content:
## Pomodoro

A simple timer following the Pomodoro technique: 25 minutes of focused work, then a 5-minute break. Helps maintain productivity by breaking work into manageable intervals.

topics.title: Key Features
topics.content:
## Key Features

**Timer** — Click the Pomodoro icon in the sidebar rail, then click Start. A timer widget appears in the status bar showing remaining time.

**Work/Break Cycle** — 25-minute work sessions followed by 5-minute breaks. A notification fires when each interval ends.

**Session Tracking** — Completed work sessions are counted per day and tracked for the last 30 days.

**Persistent State** — Timer state is saved so it resumes correctly if the app is restarted mid-session.

topics.title: Commands
topics.content:
## Commands

Available from the command palette:

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Start Pomodoro** | Starts a 25-minute work timer |
| **Stop Pomodoro** | Stops the current timer |

topics.title: Permissions
topics.content:
## Permissions

| Permission | Why it's needed |
|------------|----------------|
| **logging** | Log timer events for debugging |
| **storage** | Persist timer state and session history |
| **notifications** | Alert when work/break intervals end |
| **commands** | Register Start and Stop commands |
| **widgets** | Display the timer countdown in the status bar |
| **theme** | Adapt colors and styles to the current theme |
